title: The Missing Meeting Notes
setting: Clearpoint Health Systems, conference room, Friday 2 PM
premise: Critical board meeting notes containing sensitive merger details were stolen from the locked filing cabinet in Conference Room A. The theft occurred between Thursday 6 PM and Friday 8 AM.

suspects.name: Alan Prescott
suspects.motive: The notes contained evidence he inflated revenue numbers to the board
suspects.alibi: I left at 5:30 PM Thursday and flew to Chicago for a conference. My flight departed at 7:45 PM and I checked into the Hilton downtown by midnight. I have boarding passes.

suspects.name: Monica Silva
suspects.motive: Was offered money by a competitor for insider information about the merger
suspects.alibi: I stayed until 6:30 PM finishing correspondence, then went straight home. I was on a video call with my mother in Portugal from 7 PM until 10 PM. She can confirm the whole call.

suspects.name: Gary Linden
suspects.motive: Wants to expose lax document security to justify expanding his contract
suspects.alibi: I did my evening rounds from 6 PM to 10 PM, then went home. My route covers the entire building. I checked Conference Room A at 7 PM and everything looked normal.

suspects.name: Trish Yamamoto
suspects.motive: Opposed the merger and wanted to leak details to derail it
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 5 PM and drove to my lake house an hour away. I was there all evening with no phone reception. I drove back to the office Friday morning.

clues.title: Filing Cabinet Lock
clues.content: The filing cabinet was opened with a key, not forced. Only three people have keys: Alan, Monica, and the office manager who was on vacation all week.

clues.title: Parking Lot Camera
clues.content: The parking lot camera shows Monica's car leaving at 6:35 PM Thursday and returning at 10:25 PM the same night. She re-entered the building at 10:28 PM.

clues.title: Video Call Records
clues.content: Monica's video platform account shows her call with her mother lasted from 7:00 PM to 8:15 PM — not until 10 PM as she claimed. The call ended nearly two hours earlier.

hints.text: Think about who had both physical access to the cabinet and opportunity during the overnight window.
How long did that video call really last — does the claimed duration hold up?
